author: m0_ox
content: <@792404665068158998> <@762919002196410400>, I have been working on reconciling your efforts to talk to each other and I have them working under WIP PRs to EELS ([here](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/1381)) and EEST ([here](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/2067)). Still working on CI issues, linting, cleanup, and removing any AI slop in comments, refactoring some things, etc... but happy to report I at least have the BAL tests working ðŸ™‚

author: m0_ox
content: Some of the more recent effort there was actually creating Amsterdam forks in each of the repos so hopefully we can clean these up and establish the new fork to start developing tests (and specs) on top of.

author: m0_ox
content:
We will be iterating on the EEST side on a better organization as for now I just translated the BAL dict into pydantic objects that could be pulled in from the json and rlp serialized but <@892053833121923094> has some good suggestions we will iterate on.

I'm also going to separate the Amsterdam fork addition into its own PR on EEST side (edit: done [here](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/2069)) in case we want to add other EIPs to Amsterdam while we iterate on the BAL branches.
